label.en: 24/25 S regular part 2 7 CP MV Eng
label.et: 24/25 K PÕ 2. osa 7 EAP MV Eng

description.en:
The study of normal human anatomy deals with the  structure,
development, functional anatomy of locomotor apparates, internal, circulatory organs, 
central and peripheral nervous system. The objectives - to give the students an entire picture 
of a human  body structure, to create three-dimensional  imagination  of the body, organs, 
tissues and their  relationships. Anatomy as a basic  science of all biomedical  disciplines, 
updates modern and  future  perspectives in  basic and applied anatomy and awakes the students  
and emphasize interest in future fields of medicine.
description.et: Inimese normaalanatoomia käsitleb liikumisaparaadi, siseelundite, ringeelundite, perifeerse- ja kesknärvisüsteemi ehitust, arengut, funktsionaalanatoomiat, annab kolmemõõtmelise ettekujutuse  inimese keha struktuuridest - kudedest, organitest ning nende omavahelistest seostest.  Anatoomiaõpe, mis on eeldus- ja baasaine  paljudele  biomeditsiinilistele ja kliinilistele ainetele,  on vastavuses arstiteaduse uusimate saavutuste ja kõrgete eetiliste standarditega.

objectives.en: The aim is to introduce the student to the key concepts of anatomy that underlie the main systems of the body. To enable students to have an understanding of the development and function of human body and to give to students basic knowledge in anatomy for learning further subjects.
objectives.et: Kursuse eesmärgiks on anda üliõpilastele baasteadmisi anatoomias: anatoomia nomenklatuuri omandamine, ülevaate saamine organsüsteemidest, organite normaalsest ehitusest, arengust ja funktsioonist, seoste loomine teiste distsipliinidega. Kursuse läbimisel omandavad üliõpilased esmased kogemused ja praktilised teadmised inimkeha ehitusest vahetul kokkupuutel preparatsiooni kaudu.

learning_outcomes.en: At the end of the course, students:
1.	 knows the normal structure and functioning of the body as a whole and in each level of organisation thereof;
learning_outcomes.et: 1. oskab käsitleda terviklikult inimese organismi, selle osade ehitust seoses funktsiooni ja arenguga

learning_outcomes.en: 2. knows the main stages of individual development of a human being and medical problems related thereto
learning_outcomes.et: 2.	teab inimese loote varajast arenemist ja väärarenguid

learning_outcomes.en: 3. should name and describe, in standard terms, anatomical planes and relations and the gross anatomical components of the human body and explain their function;
learning_outcomes.et: 3.	teab elundite kuju, struktuuri ja paiknemist elundsüsteemide kaupa

learning_outcomes.en: 4. have a good command of latin anatomical terminology;
5. identify the major organs and musculo-skeletal elements of human specimens.
learning_outcomes.et: 5.    tunneb ära ja orienteerub naturaalsetel preparaatidel ja anatoomilistel mudelitel

description.et: Brain
Cranial nerves
Exam
Heart
Nerves, blood vessels,  lymphatic system

grade_preconditions.et:
Conditions for the evaluation

All requested tests have to be passed in the autumn and spring semester

grade_evaluation.et:
Formation of the final result

Exam consists of  two parts- written test and practical test (preparations). Written test comprises 80 %, practical test 20 % of the extent of the exam. Students have to be acquainted with the structure, development and functional anatomy of the organs and organ systems and know the anatomical terminology in Latin.
Examination mark is the collected results of the written and practical tests. 
Qualitative evaluation- marks A, B, C, D, E, F. The lowermost positive mark is E.
Determination of the examination mark  is equivalent to the % of  positive answeres of the extent of the exam.

debt_elimination.et:
Possibilities for eliminating undone tests and exams.
According to Study regulations of Tartu University. 
Test: on the basis of individual agreements with lecturer.

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)

description.et: Nervous system. General consideration. Classification. Assistant H. Tomusk

Week 24
General structure of the brain. Meninges, ventricles, sinuses, cisternae, spinal cord. Hemispheres. Divisions of brain. The forebrain, cerebral cortex, cerebral sulci and gyri (preparation of meninges). The inner structure of telencephalon (preparation)
Development of the nervous system. Circulation of the cerebrospinal fluid. Assistant H. Tomusk

Week 25
The  preparation of telencephalon. Lateral ventricles, nuclei basales.
Diencephalon, mesencephalon, III ventricle.
Cranial nerves. Classification.  Cranial nerves of the branchial arches. Assistant H. Tomusk

Week 26
1. Practical -  The  preparation of telencephalon. 
Rhombencephalon, IV ventricle. Circulation of the cerebrospinal fluid.
2. Practical - Test
Vegetative nervous system. Assistant H. Tomusk

Week 27
Cranial nerves, general  characteristic, classification.  Cranial nerves of visceral arches V, VII.
Afferent pathways. Assistant H. Tomusk

Week 28
Cranial nerves of visceral arches IX, X, Vegetative nervous system.
Efferent pathways and cerebellar pathways. Assistant H. Tomusk

Week 29
Afferent pathways.
Cardiovascular system. Heart. Assistant H. Tomusk

Week 30
The pyramidal motor system and its connection to the spinal nerves and cranial nerves. Tractus corticospinalis, Tr. corticonuclearis. The extrapyramidal motor system. The cerebellar pathways. Reticular activating system. Limbic system.
2. Practical - Test
Classification of the blood vessels, branching pattern, anastomoses, blood circulation,  structure  of walls of blood vessels. Microcirculation. Assistant H. Tomusk

Week 31
The dissection of corps. Knowledge of the topographic anatomical relationships - a three dimensional appreciation of the body is the one essential purposes to serve the needs of the various medical specialities.

Venous system.Veins, classification, the structure of the wall,  anastomoses, collateral circulation. Great subcutaneus veins. Hepatic portal system.
Assistant H. Tomusk

Week 32
1. Practical - Heart
2. Practical - Test
Spinal nerves I. Peripheral  nervous system. Division, branches, plexuses, spinal reflex arch. Development, classification,  functional anatomy of the spinal nerves. Associate Professor K. Kokk

Week 33
The superficial dissection of corps anteriorly.
Spinal nerves II.  Associate Professor K. Kokk

Week 34
The deep dissection of corps anteriorly.
Lymphatic system. Assistant H. Tomusk

Week 35
The superficial dissection of corps posteriorly
Sensory organs. Organ of vision - eyelids, orbits, lacrimal apparatus, eye muscles. Organ of hearing and equilibrium, external, middle ear, tympanic cavity; internal ear. Assistant H. Tomusk

Week 36
The deep dissection of corps posteriorly

Week 37
The dissection of corps

Week 38
The dissection of corps

Week 39
Test
